channel.title: Character name checking
channel.description: I don't know how common knowledge this is, but if you've ever wanted to check if a RuneScape character name is taken you can just use the [url=http://services.runescape.com/m=adventurers-log/]Adventurer's Log[/url]. If it says anything other than "Account Not Found", then the name is in use. I've found this useful when creating emails for bot accounts. I like the email address to match the character name.

item.title: Character name checking
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Gonna go ahead and lock this, ridiculous that because someone has an alternative to the one the OP posted he thinks he can act like that. Not everyone on this site is here for RSPS and even if they are that doesn’t mean they can’t program.

Read full topic

item.title: Character name checking
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“Wintercanon, post:6, topic:521684”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=640196.msg4314365#msg4314365 date=1371220418]
It’s a lot faster just using swiftkit tool though just saying it’s immediate instead of having to wait on rs site to load
[/quote]Your precious time otherwise spent fapping would be wasted on waiting for an entire webpage to load. I see your point.

I forgot none of you can program. So having a website which could be parsed within code, to tell you if a name is taken if probably useless. You go play your PI serbers now.[/quote]Wow real dick move

Read full topic

I don’t know how common knowledge this is, but if you’ve ever wanted to check if a RuneScape character name is taken you can just use the Adventurer’s Log.
